Shaker Peg Racks Use Up All-New Spots

If thereâ??s one thing a coat rack can do, itâ??s just about anything. What used to be a rustic style trademark has grown to be at home in any setting, and for many more purposes than its designers ever imagined.

You can still find wall coat hooks in the hardware store in many sizes; ready to paint and coordinate to your color scheme. They are ubiquitous in flea markets and vintage stores. Now they are stating to pop up in trendy name brand outlets and have even found their way into modern and contemporary design houses.

Part of this trending flexibility of style is a rediscovery of the features that made them so useful in the first place. Long ago a farmer would choose between a nail and a peg to hang gear, either inside the house or inside barn. A nail was cheap together with easy, but the peg was less likely to damage leather and fabric goods with stains or creases. The shaker style added a nice aesthetic to the simple wooden rod and its rounded end would present a friendlier touch to fabrics draped into it. This same gentle hand is valued again today for a lot more than hanging horse tack and garments.

For wall coat racks the wide rounded end is considerate to many of todayâ??s cashmeres and silks, and inside bathroom towels draped over a peg are soft and ready to grab. Wider versions of the pegs are well suited for low walls where younger kids can hang their coats without the safety concerns of a wire hook.

But the shaker peg rack is not limited to garments and its large diameter and forgiving wooden material are well-suited to use for jewelry, ties or belts. They are often painted or gold-leafed to make a dynamic hanger for paintings or dietary fiber art. Artists and craftspeople who make exhibit booths to come up with their work can rely on the strong bearing weight in the shaker style while providing a look which will match their wares. Indeed the shaker peg rack has wangled its way into modern-style displays of glass and fine art as it quietly serves whatever require is desired.

Painted, stained, leafed, metalized, enameled, and also plain wood; the Shaker Peg Rack is a home in any dÃ©cor, and serves side by side with any material with its still gentle hand and flexible performance. There are traveled many paths since its respectful origin; but the sophistication of the peg today has caught on once again.

Create Space And An Classy Design Using Wall Coat Hook Varie

Whether you have children or not, when coming home from school or work, the last thing you want to see is a coat, purse or backpack lying in the floor. It can be a bit bothersome to see these types of items not put in their proper place. Not only is it bothersome, it can be a walking hazard. Having a place to hang up such items is not only a necessity, but will add style to your home as well. When looking for a wall coat rack , there are a variety of colors and styles to look at and choose from today. There are many designs and colors are available to anyone looking to create space and unclutter their home.

Here are two way to unclutter your home or office space.

Organization

One way coat hooks become useful is for organization. As it turns out, coats are not the only thing that needs to be put in its place. When it comes to being organized, it just makes one’s life easier and creates a cleaner home or work environment. Having a messy home or office can lead to unintended stress. There is no need for stress when a home or office has everything in a place that can be found easily and in plain view.

Home Décor

Today, with all the designs and colors to look at a wall coat rack in your home or office will have a décor that is not too outlandish. In fact, a new way to add a little décor to a home or office is simply to hang your coat, purse or important documents on the wall. The best type of home or office décor is the kind that allows for adding more space and creating less clutter at the same time. When you can attach something to a wall and remove the clutter, you are already ahead of the game and your home or office will look presentable.

Shopping for Wall Coat Hooks

These days it does not matter where you are shopping because more likely than not, they will be selling a variety of coat hooks. High end, home décor, discount and online stores are all selling whatever shape, color or style you are looking for. There are different mediums used to your liking as well. There are hooks made from wood, metal and iron. Some are made to look like rope, polished, beaded and so much more. Shopping has become easier today because one can shop online at any store that might be related to brick and mortar for all your home or office décor needs.

How To A Guide To Refinishing Coat Shelves

Coat racks are quite simply iconic. They have been a mainstay in homes across America for generations. Due to this, various do-it-yourself warriors have come up with hundreds of different styles and modes of accomplishing the same task. Currently vintage style with a twist is all of the rage and refinishing your own coat rack is a great way to add this character to your home (without making permanent changes if the fad fades out) or breaking the bank.

Your first step is to search flea markets, antique malls or online websites for coat racks. Explore your options, as coat racks
are available in everything from the luxurious, ornate Victorian style to the height of minimalist furniture design in the 1960s. Either plastic or wood will work but if you find something in oak make sure you like the pattern of the wood grain. High quality oak has a very strong grain that will stand out under either paint or stain.

Now that you're all set, here are some simple steps to having your perfect coat rack.

1. Prepare your workspace: This is an often overlooked step but doing it properly will save you a headache in the end. Put down a plastic tarp or a few trash bags and make sure all materials are within easy reach.

2. Clean: All wood products, no matter how they have been finished, love dirt. Even if it looks sparkly clean just assume that it is not. You will be surprised with what you can remove. Wipe plastic down with a wet paper towel.

3. Sanding/Scoring: If your coat rack is wood it will need to be sanded down. In general, the more sanding the better as it will leave you with a cleaner and more precise work surface. Plastic will need to be scored (with sandpaper) lightly. This will give the primer something to hold and will prevent flaking.

4. Staining/Painting: Carefully apply wood stain in your chosen color, and follow the directions on the can as specifically as possible. If you like a distressed look, brushing the stain on and quickly wiping it away with a rag looks excellent. For plastic, apply one or two coats of primer first. Allow this to dry before applying one or two coats of paint.

5. Lacquer (Wood Only): Applying a clear lacquer is optional, but will provide a beautiful sheen to the wood. Ensure you leave it plenty of time to dry.

It is important to note that while this method will work for changing an oak wall coat racks into looking like maple, there is no reason not to be bold. Why not have hot pink wall coat hooks ? Oak looks beautiful under ebony and mahogany staining and adds drama to the preexisting grain. Adding multiple layers of paint in different colors, and then sanding the top coat off in strategic places is an aging technique that offers lovely pops of color. Which ever route you choose, good luck and happy refinishing.

From the front door to the back door, it is a versatile and affordable accessory to the home that does not take up any floor space.

Hallway Closets

It is so nice to be able to say to a casual friend, "Just hang your coat on any hook," or take your guests coat and inform them by stating, "I'm putting your coat right here." They are so handy, not to mention when you have a lots of company! Because buying coat racks is inexpensive and sold at most stores, you can have as many as you want hung in your foyer. In fact, mixing racks with old fashioned hooks can look very nice. The option to have your guests coats handy and visable to them may be a comfort. It sure beats piling them all up on the bed.

As for the homeowner, we all have that certain coat, jacket or cap that we like to be easily accessible and a shelf coat rack can make that happen. It allows you the ease of access to your daily wearables, and other necessities. Cramming your coat into an already overloaded closet is a hassle and can be quite a headache. Hooks can actually ease the burden of too much stuff that the closet may be feeling.

Is Really A Wooden Coat Rack In Your Long Term?

Coats are outer garments that normally needs careful storage and cannot just be kept or left anywhere or anyhow, lest they build a nasty mold smell. Due to their unique make and unlike other garments, coats need careful and organized way of keeping. This calls for good care to be taken while placing a coat in order to keep it in good condition. Coats should be kept free from dirt and moisture, in a place with heat and open air to avoid the formation of stuffy mold smell as indicated earlier, given that one cannot was a coat after every one use. This leads to the reason why coat racks
are important.

Leaving a coat lying anywhere in the house will leave the house looking disorganized and disastrous. Coat hungers or racks are the best option for every homeowner and not just any hungers or racks, but wooden rack due to its reliability, durability and sturdily. Wooden coat racks creates a sense of beauty out or their traditional and classical designing, in that wood easily takes into any natural traditional beauty. Wood itself also is warm and welcoming to any home.

Wood wall coat hooks are designed differently, each design giving a classic desired look while placed/fixed in specific places and one can easily get one that suitably depicts the desired outlook, for the place where the coat hungers or racks are fixed. Some are ideal for bedroom, living room, waiting room, office and shop display among other. They are designed in a way that they can be used for more than one purpose at the same time, for instance, wooden coat stands, some of which are made with round table, gives an elegant look to ones home or office. This kind of coat hook is also ideal for a waiting room. Made in high quality, good design with good solid finish, and they take very small space.

Thru-block wall coat rack, gives a good example of coat racks ideal for modern homes. They are antique in look with a moose head that adds a touch of outdoorsy manliness to the home. They can be made in any as one so desires as it works easily on different wall spaces. Wooden coat rack with shelves, another type of wood coat hook which gives a combination of beauty and usage all in one and best choice for home decoration, with a flat top on which flowers can be placed for more home decor.

Wooden coat hungers or racks are simply the best solution for proper coat placement!
